titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Silas K. Steadsman, Transcript
CWG10518

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Scott Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Silas N. Steadman

(A)
The Grand Jury of Scott county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Silas N Steadman of the offence of carrying concealed weapons committed as follows viz: The Said Silas N Steadman on the 26 day of November 1860, in the county aforesaid did carry concealed upon his person a deadly weapon other than a common pocket Knife towit a pistol against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky.

A true Bill
E. H. Parrish foreman
filed & noted Nov 26. 1860
A Copy att James Y Kelly C S C C
Scott Circuit Court May Term 1861 May 21st

The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
against } no 250 Misdemeanor
Silas N. Steadman Defendant

(B)
This day came the Comths attorney & the defendant and by agreement the law and fact is submitted to the court, and the Court being advised. It is adjudged that the plaintiff recover of the defendant fifty dollars and the costs of this prosecution
A copy att James Y Kelly C S C C

Scott Cir. Ct
$50 } Weapons
S. N. Steadman
Remissions Issd Aug 14. 1861
